raw_response:
{
  "deal_structure": "Agreement and Plan of Merger dated September 22, 2025 among Compass, Inc. (\"Compass\" or the \"Company\"), Velocity Merger Sub, Inc. (a wholly owned Compass subsidiary), and Anywhere Real Estate Inc. (\"Anywhere\"). Structure is a forward triangular merger: Merger Sub merges with and into Anywhere, with Anywhere surviving as a wholly owned subsidiary of Compass. Consideration is all-stock: each share of Anywhere common stock (subject to customary excluded shares) converts into the right to receive 1.436 shares of Compass Class A common stock (the \"Exchange Ratio\"), plus cash in lieu of fractional shares. Transaction intended to qualify as a tax-free reorganization under IRC Section 368(a). Post-close, Anywhere common stock to be delisted from NYSE and deregistered under the Exchange Act.  ",
  "purchase_price": "Per-share consideration: 1.436 shares of Compass Class A common stock per Anywhere share, plus cash in lieu of fractional shares. No fixed cash price, collar, implied equity value, or value-per-share in dollars is stated in the provided excerpted merger agreement summary. ",
  "conditions_to_closing": "Key closing conditions include: (i) Compass stockholder approval of the issuance of Compass shares in the merger (majority of outstanding Compass common stock entitled to vote and represented at the meeting), (ii) Anywhere stockholder approval to adopt the merger agreement (majority of outstanding Anywhere common stock entitled to vote), (iii) NYSE authorization for listing of Compass shares to be issued, (iv) effectiveness of Compass registration statement for issuance of the Compass shares, (v) expiration/termination of the HSR waiting period, (vi) no injunction/order/law prohibiting the merger, and (vii) accuracy of reps/warranties (subject to materiality standards) and material compliance with covenants/obligations. ",
  "termination_provisions": "Outside Date / long-stop: either party may terminate if the merger has not closed by September 22, 2026, subject to three automatic 3-month extensions if, on each such date, all closing conditions other than regulatory approvals have been satisfied or waived. Other termination rights include: (i) final, nonappealable law/order prohibiting the merger; (ii) failure to obtain Anywhere stockholder approval (termination right for Compass) or failure to obtain Compass stockholder approval (termination right for Anywhere); (iii) material uncured breach by the other party; and (iv) change of board recommendation (Compass can terminate if Anywhere board changes recommendation; Anywhere can terminate if Compass board changes recommendation). Fee regime: (a) under certain specified circumstances, a $200 million termination fee is payable by Compass or Anywhere (as applicable); and (b) if the agreement is terminated because required regulatory clearances are not obtained before the Outside Date or if the merger is permanently enjoined, Compass must pay Anywhere a $350 million termination fee (functionally a regulatory reverse termination fee payable by the buyer). Specific performance is available to compel performance of obligations.   ",
  "mac_provisions": "The provided document excerpts do not include the definition of Material Adverse Effect/Material Adverse Change or any MAE/MAC carve-outs; therefore, MAC scope and carve-outs cannot be summarized from the provided text. ",
  "other_material_terms": "Non-solicitation: both parties have non-solicitation obligations relating to alternative business combination proposals (no further detail on fiduciary out, matching rights, or go-shop in the provided excerpts). Regulatory efforts: parties must use reasonable best efforts to obtain antitrust and other required regulatory approvals, subject to limitations in the agreement (limitations not detailed in the provided excerpts). Financing: Compass entered into a debt financing commitment letter on September 22, 2025 with Morgan Stanley Senior Funding, Inc. for up to $750 million via a 364-day senior secured bridge loan facility; proceeds expected to refinance certain existing Anywhere indebtedness and pay related fees/costs/expenses, with Compass intending to refinance through capital markets transactions (and use the bridge only to the extent necessary). Support/voting agreements: (i) Compass CEO Robert L. Reffkin and affiliated funds (approx. 29.6% of Compass voting power) agreed to vote in favor of the Compass share issuance and agreed to transfer restrictions (subject to limited exceptions); (ii) Angelo, Gordon & Co.-advised funds/accounts (approx. 8.7% of Anywhere common stock) agreed to vote in favor of adopting the merger agreement and agreed to transfer restrictions (subject to limited exceptions). Equity awards: Anywhere RSUs/DSUs/PSUs convert into Compass time-based RSUs based on the Exchange Ratio (with PSUs converted to service-based vesting and performance treated per the described averaging/actual/extrapolation mechanics); certain Anywhere options are net-exercised/cashed out in stock consideration for non-employees, while other options are assumed and adjusted by the Exchange Ratio (shares multiplied; exercise price divided).   ",
  "reasoning": "I extracted the banker-relevant economic and structural terms by locating the sections describing (i) merger structure and consideration mechanics, (ii) closing conditions (votes, regulatory, listing/registration), (iii) termination rights/Outside Date and fee amounts (including the regulatory-specific $350mm fee), and (iv) other economically material provisions (financing commitment, support agreements, and treatment of equity awards). Where the provided excerpts did not include a definition (e.g., MAE/MAC), I did not infer or speculate.",
  "reasoning_steps": [
    "Step 1: Located the transaction structure and consideration by pulling the merger description (Merger Sub into Anywhere; Anywhere survives) and the per-share exchange ratio language, then captured any stated tax treatment and delisting/deregistration consequences.",
    "Step 2: Validated conditions and termination economics by extracting the enumerated closing conditions (stockholder approvals, HSR, registration/listing, no injunction) and then separately capturing the Outside Date mechanics and the two-tier termination fee framework ($200mm general fee in specified circumstances; $350mm payable by Compass for regulatory failure/permanent injunction)."
  ]
}

parsed_response.deal_structure: Agreement and Plan of Merger dated September 22, 2025 among Compass, Inc. ("Compass" or the "Company"), Velocity Merger Sub, Inc. (a wholly owned Compass subsidiary), and Anywhere Real Estate Inc. ("Anywhere"). Structure is a forward triangular merger: Merger Sub merges with and into Anywhere, with Anywhere surviving as a wholly owned subsidiary of Compass. Consideration is all-stock: each share of Anywhere common stock (subject to customary excluded shares) converts into the right to receive 1.436 shares of Compass Class A common stock (the "Exchange Ratio"), plus cash in lieu of fractional shares. Transaction intended to qualify as a tax-free reorganization under IRC Section 368(a). Post-close, Anywhere common stock to be delisted from NYSE and deregistered under the Exchange Act.
parsed_response.purchase_price: Per-share consideration: 1.436 shares of Compass Class A common stock per Anywhere share, plus cash in lieu of fractional shares. No fixed cash price, collar, implied equity value, or value-per-share in dollars is stated in the provided excerpted merger agreement summary.
parsed_response.conditions_to_closing: Key closing conditions include: (i) Compass stockholder approval of the issuance of Compass shares in the merger (majority of outstanding Compass common stock entitled to vote and represented at the meeting), (ii) Anywhere stockholder approval to adopt the merger agreement (majority of outstanding Anywhere common stock entitled to vote), (iii) NYSE authorization for listing of Compass shares to be issued, (iv) effectiveness of Compass registration statement for issuance of the Compass shares, (v) expiration/termination of the HSR waiting period, (vi) no injunction/order/law prohibiting the merger, and (vii) accuracy of reps/warranties (subject to materiality standards) and material compliance with covenants/obligations.
parsed_response.termination_provisions: Outside Date / long-stop: either party may terminate if the merger has not closed by September 22, 2026, subject to three automatic 3-month extensions if, on each such date, all closing conditions other than regulatory approvals have been satisfied or waived. Other termination rights include: (i) final, nonappealable law/order prohibiting the merger; (ii) failure to obtain Anywhere stockholder approval (termination right for Compass) or failure to obtain Compass stockholder approval (termination right for Anywhere); (iii) material uncured breach by the other party; and (iv) change of board recommendation (Compass can terminate if Anywhere board changes recommendation; Anywhere can terminate if Compass board changes recommendation). Fee regime: (a) under certain specified circumstances, a $200 million termination fee is payable by Compass or Anywhere (as applicable); and (b) if the agreement is terminated because required regulatory clearances are not obtained before the Outside Date or if the merger is permanently enjoined, Compass must pay Anywhere a $350 million termination fee (functionally a regulatory reverse termination fee payable by the buyer). Specific performance is available to compel performance of obligations.
parsed_response.mac_provisions: The provided document excerpts do not include the definition of Material Adverse Effect/Material Adverse Change or any MAE/MAC carve-outs; therefore, MAC scope and carve-outs cannot be summarized from the provided text.
parsed_response.other_material_terms: Non-solicitation: both parties have non-solicitation obligations relating to alternative business combination proposals (no further detail on fiduciary out, matching rights, or go-shop in the provided excerpts). Regulatory efforts: parties must use reasonable best efforts to obtain antitrust and other required regulatory approvals, subject to limitations in the agreement (limitations not detailed in the provided excerpts). Financing: Compass entered into a debt financing commitment letter on September 22, 2025 with Morgan Stanley Senior Funding, Inc. for up to $750 million via a 364-day senior secured bridge loan facility; proceeds expected to refinance certain existing Anywhere indebtedness and pay related fees/costs/expenses, with Compass intending to refinance through capital markets transactions (and use the bridge only to the extent necessary). Support/voting agreements: (i) Compass CEO Robert L. Reffkin and affiliated funds (approx. 29.6% of Compass voting power) agreed to vote in favor of the Compass share issuance and agreed to transfer restrictions (subject to limited exceptions); (ii) Angelo, Gordon & Co.-advised funds/accounts (approx. 8.7% of Anywhere common stock) agreed to vote in favor of adopting the merger agreement and agreed to transfer restrictions (subject to limited exceptions). Equity awards: Anywhere RSUs/DSUs/PSUs convert into Compass time-based RSUs based on the Exchange Ratio (with PSUs converted to service-based vesting and performance treated per the described averaging/actual/extrapolation mechanics); certain Anywhere options are net-exercised/cashed out in stock consideration for non-employees, while other options are assumed and adjusted by the Exchange Ratio (shares multiplied; exercise price divided).
parsed_response.reasoning: I extracted the banker-relevant economic and structural terms by locating the sections describing (i) merger structure and consideration mechanics, (ii) closing conditions (votes, regulatory, listing/registration), (iii) termination rights/Outside Date and fee amounts (including the regulatory-specific $350mm fee), and (iv) other economically material provisions (financing commitment, support agreements, and treatment of equity awards). Where the provided excerpts did not include a definition (e.g., MAE/MAC), I did not infer or speculate.
reasoning_steps: Step 1: Located the transaction structure and consideration by pulling the merger description (Merger Sub into Anywhere; Anywhere survives) and the per-share exchange ratio language, then captured any stated tax treatment and delisting/deregistration consequences.

Step 2: Validated conditions and termination economics by extracting the enumerated closing conditions (stockholder approvals, HSR, registration/listing, no injunction) and then separately capturing the Outside Date mechanics and the two-tier termination fee framework ($200mm general fee in specified circumstances; $350mm payable by Compass for regulatory failure/permanent injunction).
